title: 2016 Mazda CX-5 going on 120k miles without issue.
description: I get the cheapest synthetic 0w-20 oil I can find for my 2016 Mazda CX-5 and the Amazon synthetic is usually the cheapest. My CX-5 is running great after 115k miles and I don't drive it easy. I let my kid do the little automatic shifter and we use Sport mode often revving it up and keeping life interesting. The engine runs great and I wouldn't hesitate to use Amazon synthetic oil in any car. After all, it meets the same standards as any other oil for a conventional car.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023

title: Made by Warren
description: Full syn, I change my oil every 5,000.  It states good for 10,000, but no way do i feel comfortable waiting that long. Oil is cheap, engines are expensive
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023

title: Works As Intended
description: I’m no mechanic. This is a typical engine oil. I’ve used this before, and I don’t notice anything wrong with the car. I guess it works fine. This one in particular is for 2016 Lexus CT 200h. When I drained the last batch of oil after 5,000 miles of use, the color of the oil is still brown. Not as bad as I would think. I’ve seen old oil came out of this car at about the same mileage, and it was almost black. I think that was Pennzoil.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023

title: All oil is the same
description: You always pay for a brand when it comes to oil. Why waste money on the same thing when you can get this? Very good buy
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023

title: Works for me
description: Works well.  No different than the pricier ones.  I change every 5k miles.  I'm not pushing it to 10K to save $25.
